title: 法国研发出可大幅度降低功耗的仿生定位系统
keyword: 仿生定位系统 传感器 控制器 电阻式随机存取存储器
content_zh: 受谷仓猫头鹰的启发，研究人员开发了一种创新的定位系统，将最先进的传感器和基于电阻随机存取存储器(RRAM)的神经形态计算地图结合起来。随着我们进入普适计算时代，越来越多的日常物品被嵌入微处理器，以帮助我们的生活顺利进行。 为了实现这一点，这些系统需要连续运行，并浪费最小的能量，同时从实时从几个传感器捕获的噪声和通常不完整的数据中提取有用和紧凑的信息。 多亏了它们在内存中、事件驱动的计算能力，混合记忆互补金属氧化物半导体(CMOS)神经形态结构为此类任务提供了理想的硬件基底。研究人员得到了MEM-Scales项目的部分支持，该项目旨在展示这种系统的全部潜力。 为此，他们开发了一种生物启发、事件驱动的对象定位系统，该系统将先进的压电微机械超声换能器(PMUT)传感器与基于RRAM的神经形态计算地图相结合。 他们发表在《自然通讯》杂志上的论文描述了与传统的基于微控制器的定位系统相比，提出的神经形态方法如何将功耗降低五个数量级。受自然启发，该系统的灵感来自谷仓猫头鹰的神经解剖学。 该研究的资深作者Elisa Vianello博士在EE Times上发表的一篇新闻中指出：“我们提出的解决方案代表了展示生物启发系统提高计算效率的概念的第一步。” “它为更复杂的系统铺平了道路，这些系统通过结合从不同传感器提取的信息来执行更复杂的任务，以解决现实世界的问题。”我们设想，这种构思生物启发系统的方法将是构建下一代边缘人工智能设备的关键，在这种设备中，信息在本地以最少的资源进行处理。 特别是，我们相信小动物和昆虫是一个很大的灵感来源，可以有效地结合感官信息处理和计算。 由于技术的最新进步，我们可以将创新的传感器与基于RRAM的先进计算相结合，以构建超低功耗系统，“Vianello博士说，他是法国替代能源和原子能委员会MEM-Scales项目协调员电子和信息技术实验室CEA-Leti的高级科学家。研究小组对由基于RRAM的符合探测器、延迟线电路和全定制超声波传感器组成的系统进行了测量。 他们用实验结果来校准系统级模拟。 然后利用这些仿真来估计目标定位模型的角分辨率和能量效率。 结果显示，与执行相同任务的微控制器相比，能源效率要高得多。 “我们的目标一如既往地是为特定应用程序所需的性能水平获得最佳的电源效率。Vianelloo博士观察到：”我们的系统肯定有可能进一步提高能效。“这项研究表明，应该探索将动态视觉传感器相机等视觉传感器与基于PMUT的听觉传感器结合起来，以开发未来的消费机器人。 MEM-Scales（神经形态结构的多尺度时间常数记忆技术）项目将于2023年6月结束。
content_en: Bio-inspired localization system slashes power consumptionInspired by barn owls, researchers have developed an innovative localization system that combines state-of-the-art sensors with a neuromorphic computational map based on resistive random-access memory (RRAM).As we enter the era of pervasive computing, more and more of our everyday objects are being embedded with microprocessors to help our lives run smoothly. To achieve this, these systems need to operate continuously and waste minimal energy, all while extracting useful and compact information from noisy and often incomplete data captured from several sensors in real time. Thanks to their in-memory, event-driven computing capabilities, hybrid memristive complementary metal-oxide semiconductor (CMOS) neuromorphic architectures provide an ideal hardware subaate for such tasks.Researchers supported in part by the MeM-Scales project set out to demonaate the full potential of such a system. To this end, they developed a bio-inspired, event-driven object localization system that couples advanced piezoelectric micro-machined ultrasound transducer (PMUT) sensors with a neuromorphic computational map based on RRAM. Their paper published in the journal Nature Communications describes how the proposed neuromorphic approach has made it possible to reduce power consumption by five orders of magnitude compared with conventional localization systems based on microcontrollers.Inspired by natureInspiration for the system was drawn from the barn owl's neuroanatomy. "Our proposed solution represents a first step in demonaating the concept of a biologically inspired system to improve efficiency in computation," notes study senior author Dr. Elisa Vianello in a news item posted on EE Times. "It paves the way toward more complex systems that perform even more sophisticated tasks to solve real–world problems by combining information extracted from different sensors."We envision that such an approach to conceive a bio–inspired system will be key to build the next generation of edge AI devices, in which information is processed locally and with minimal resources. In particular, we believe that small animals and insects are a great source of inspiration for an efficient combination of sensory information processing and computation. Thanks to the latest advancements in technology, we can couple innovative sensors with advanced RRAM–based computation to build ultra–low–power systems," states Dr. Vianello, who is a senior scientist at electronics and information technology laboratory CEA-Leti of MeM-Scales project coordinator French Alternative Energies and Atomic Energy Commission in France.The research team conducted measurements of the system consisting of RRAM-based coincidence detectors, delay-line circuits and a full-custom ultrasound sensor. They used the experimental results to calibrate the system-level simulations. These simulations were then used to estimate the object localization model's angular resolution and energy efficiency. The results showed much greater energy efficiency than a microcontroller performing the same task. "The goal is, as always, to get the best power efficiency for the level of performance needed by a specific application. Further improvements in energy efficiency are certainly possible with our system," observes Dr. Vianello.The study demonaates that combining visual sensors such as dynamic vision sensor cameras with a PMUT-based hearing sensor should be explored to develop future consumer robots. The MeM-Scales (Memory technologies with multi-scale time constants for neuromorphic architectures) project ends in June 2023.
abaact: 近日，法国一个研究小组受仓鸮启发，通过将顶级传感器与基于电阻式随机存取存储器（RRAM）的神经形态计算图相结合，开发出一款新型定位系统。系统由基于RRAM的符合探测器、延迟线电路和完全定制的超声波传感器组成。实验中，研究小组利用实验结果进行校准系统级模拟，再通过这些模拟估计对象定位模型的角分辨率和能量效率。结果表明，与微控制器相比，该系统的能源效率更高，而与基于微控制器的传统系统相比，功耗更是较之低了五个量级。这项研究促进了定位系统技术的创新，从根本上解决了传统定位系统在处理信息时产生的高耗能问题，也为构建下一代边缘人工智能设备提供了技术支持，提高了开发消费类机器人的可能性。

title: 美国开发出适应平价电动汽车的快速充电技术
keyword: 高能量密度电池 内部热调制 超薄镍箔
content_zh: 电池技术的突破为大规模采用负担得起的电动汽车铺平了道路。电动汽车电池设计的突破使一个典型的电动汽车电池的充电时间达到了10分钟。 今天（10月12日）在《自然》杂志上宣布，更短的充电时间和更长的旅行里程所获得的更多能量的破纪录组合。宾夕法尼亚州立大学机械工程教授、该研究的主要作者王朝阳说：“对更小、充电更快的电池的需求比以往任何时候都大。” “根本没有足够的电池和关键原材料，尤其是国内生产的原材料，来满足预期的需求。”8月，加州空气资源委员会通过了一项广泛的计划，限制并最终禁止在该州销售汽油动力汽车。 到2035年，美国最大的汽车市场将有效地退役内燃机。王解释说，如果新车销售将转向电池驱动的电动汽车，它们需要克服两个主要缺点：充电太慢，体积太大，效率和价格都不高。 根据电池的不同，一些电动汽车可以花一整天的时间充电，而不是在气泵上花几分钟。“我们的快速充电技术适用于大多数能量密集的电池，并将打开一个新的可能性，将电动汽车电池从150千瓦时缩小到50千瓦时，而不会导致司机感到里程焦虑，”王说，他的实验室与州立大学的初创公司EC Power合作开发这项技术。 “更小、充电更快的电池将大幅降低电池成本和钴、石墨和锂等关键原材料的使用，从而使负担得起的电动汽车得到大量采用。”王解释说，这项技术依赖于内部热调制，这是一种主动的温度控制方法，可以要求电池尽可能最佳的性能。 电池在热的时候工作效率最高，但不会太热。 使电池始终保持在合适的温度是电池工程师面临的主要挑战。 王说，历史上，他们依赖外部庞大的加热和冷却系统来调节电池温度，这些系统反应缓慢，浪费大量能源。王和他的团队决定从电池内部调节温度。 研究人员开发了一种新的电池结构，除了阳极、电解液和阴极之外，还添加了超薄镍箔作为第四组分。 王解释说，镍箔作为一种刺激，可以自我调节电池的温度和反应性，这使得几乎任何电动汽车电池都可以快速充电10分钟。“真正的快充电池会产生立竿见影的效果，”研究人员写道。 “由于没有足够的原料矿物让每辆内燃机汽车被150千瓦时的电动汽车取代，快速充电对于电动汽车成为主流至关重要。”王说，这项研究的合作伙伴EC Power正在努力制造和商业化快速充电电池，以实现负担得起和可持续的汽车电气化未来。该研究的其他合著者是宾夕法尼亚州立大学的刘腾、杨晓光、葛山海和冷永军以及EC Power的纳撒尼尔·斯坦利、埃里克·朗特里和布莱恩·麦卡锡。
content_en: Battery tech breakthrough paves way for mass adoption of affordable electric carA breakthrough in electric vehicle battery design has enabled a 10-minute charge time for a typical EV battery. The record-breaking combination of a shorter charge time and more energy acquired for longer travel range was announced today (Oct. 12) in the journal Nature."The need for smaller, faster-charging batteries is greater than ever," said Chao-Yang Wang, the William E. Diefenderfer Professor of Mechanical Engineering at Penn State and lead author on the study. "There are simply not enough batteries and critical raw materials, especially those produced domestically, to meet anticipated demand."In August, California's Air Resources Board passed an extensive plan to reaict and ultimately ban the sale of gasoline-powered cars within the state. By 2035, the largest auto market in the United States will effectively retire the internal combustion engine.If new car sales are going to shift to battery-powered electric vehicles (EVs), Wang explained, they'll need to overcome two major drawbacks: they are too slow to recharge and too large to be efficient and affordable. Instead of taking a few minutes at the gas pump, depending on the battery, some EVs can take all day to recharge."Our fast-charging technology works for most energy-dense batteries and will open a new possibility to downsize electric vehicle batteries from 150 to 50 kWh without causing drivers to feel range anxiety," said Wang, whose lab partnered with State College-based startup EC Power to develop the technology. "The smaller, faster-charging batteries will dramatically cut down battery cost and usage of critical raw materials such as cobalt, graphite and lithium, enabling mass adoption of affordable electric cars."The technology relies on internal thermal modulation, an active method of temperature control to demand the best performance possible from the battery, Wang explained. Batteries operate most efficiently when they are hot, but not too hot. Keeping batteries consistently at just the right temperature has been major challenge for battery engineers. Historically, they have relied on external, bulky heating and cooling systems to regulate battery temperature, which respond slowly and waste a lot of energy, Wang said.Wang and his team decided to instead regulate the temperature from inside the battery. The researchers developed a new battery aucture that adds an ultrathin nickel foil as the fourth component besides anode, electrolyte and cathode. Acting as a stimulus, the nickel foil self-regulates the battery's temperature and reactivity which allows for 10-minute fast charging on just about any EV battery, Wang explained."True fast-charging batteries would have immediate impact," the researchers write. "Since there are not enough raw minerals for every internal combustion engine car to be replaced by a 150 kWh-equipped EV, fast charging is imperative for EVs to go mainaeam."The study's partner, EC Power, is working to manufacture and commercialize the fast-charging battery for an affordable and sustainable future of vehicle electrification, Wang said.The other coauthors on the study are Teng Liu, Xiao-Guang Yang, Shanhai Ge and Yongjun Leng of Penn State and Nathaniel Stanley, Eric Rountree and Brian McCarthy of EC Power.
abaact: 近日，美国宾夕法尼亚州立大学和宾州州立大学、EC Power公司合作开发出了适用于绝大多拥有高能量密度电池电动车的快速充电技术。该项技术主要依赖于内部热调制，为了让电池始终保持在合适的温度工作，该团队开发出了一种新的电池结构，在阳极、电解质和阴极之外添加了超薄镍箔作为第四种成分，从电池的内部来调节温度。其中，镍箔可以自行调节电池的温度和反应性，这使得任何电动汽车电池都可以在10分钟内进行快速充电。该技术可以将电动汽车电池的使用的能量损耗从150千瓦时减少到50千瓦时，从而缓解开车司机的焦虑。目前，EC Power公司正在致力于制造快速充电电池并将其商业化，以实现汽车电气化的可持续发展。

title: 美国多个芯片制造商争夺联邦政府巨额补贴
keyword: 芯片制造商 联邦援助计划 半导体制造业
content_zh: 芯片制造商在争取联邦援助时提供巨额投资。世界顶级半导体制造商最近几个月宣布了美国的长期投资，可能超过4000亿美元，理由是来自一项新的联邦援助计划的支持，该计划的规则尚未制定。英特尔、美光、IBM、三星、台湾半导体制造公司和其他公司表示，他们建造或扩大美国半导体制造设施或晶圆厂的计划至少在一定程度上取决于获得联邦资金。这些公司广为人知的声明， 乔·拜登总统参与了英特尔在俄亥俄州的一项奠基工程，并参观了IBM在纽约的一家工厂，这表明了政治、经济和安全动机，这些动机导致国会在8月份颁布了一项旨在恢复美国半导体芯片制造的法律。但这些声明也是在商务部制定分发援助规则的几个月前发布的。商务部管理着法律挪用的近500亿美元赠款。 该部门计划在2月份开始接受申请，第一批赠款不太可能在2024年初夏之前发放。早期的声明及其规模与2018年威斯康星州的一次活动如出一辙，当时美国总统唐纳德·特朗普（Donald Trump)、州长斯科特·沃克（Scott Walker）和众议院议长保罗·瑞安（Paul Ryan）与富士康首席执行官郭台铭（Terry Gou）一起，启动了一个100亿美元的项目，为电视和智能手机制造平板显示器。 四年多后，该公司将项目投资减少到数亿美元，理由是需求疲软和供应商基础不足。争夺芯片赠款的公司没有说他们希望获得多少，也没有说获得低于预期的赠款是否会改变他们的投资计划，但他们正在指望它。英特尔负责政府关系的副总裁阿尔·汤普森（Al Thompson）在接受采访时表示：“我们一直清楚，随着我们做出的每一项声明，芯片法案资助对实施这些计划的重要性。” “我们如此大胆地推动《芯片法案》获得资金的原因之一是，它对我们在美国的投资至关重要。”英特尔尤其直言不讳地谈到了其投资和赠款之间的联系。 今年6月，当立法在国会陷入僵局时，首席执行官帕特·格尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）警告说，该公司将“缓慢而小，否则我们将根据《芯片法案》(Chips Act）做大而大胆。”英特尔表示，未来十年，它可能会投资高达1000亿美元，在俄亥俄州建设世界上最大的芯片制造综合体之一，其中可能包括多达8家晶圆厂，但初步投资约为200亿美元。 该公司还在亚利桑那州和新墨西哥州开发设施。美光首席执行官桑杰·梅赫罗特拉（Sanjay Mehrotra）也将该公司10月初宣布的在纽约州北部建设晶圆厂的20年1000亿美元计划归因于法律。 “毫无疑问，如果没有《芯片法案》，我们今天就不会在这里，”梅赫罗特拉在宣布计划时说。立法者和政府官员表示，这项立法旨在扭转美国芯片制造业的下降趋势，从1990年的40%降至2019年的11%。 台湾的台积电和韩国的三星是世界领先的生产商，中国正在大力投资建设能力。这些国家的政府提供了大量补贴，帮助这些公司建设能力。建立分配结构商务部的国家标准和技术研究所已经开始通过寻求信息来确定如何分配赠款，包括10月12日要求公司就如何构建该项目发表评论。 这些评论将于11月14日前发表。 一名部门官员只是表示，在评估申请之前，不会做出资金决定。目前的半导体努力在几个方面与富士康的威斯康辛项目不同。 半导体支出结合了联邦支出和税收激励措施，以支持整个供应链，包括长期研究。 富士康项目得到了国家税收优惠政策的支持，以鼓励创造就业机会。 联邦援助是否会扭转半导体制造业持续十年的下降还有待观察。半导体制造业通常需要规模经济，要求公司建立大量产能来降低成本。 台积电和三星各自运营着多个晶圆厂，月产量为数百万片晶圆或光盘，生产单个芯片。这些公司承认，他们现在正在努力使该项目发挥自己的优势。汤普森说：“公司现在正试图寻找合适的方法来确保我们的应用程序包括该部门在劳动力发展、利用私人资本方面寻找的标准，我们将在2月份前准备好。”信息技术和创新基金会(ITIF)全球创新政策总监斯蒂芬·埃塞尔（Stephen Ezell）
content_en: Chip makers offer big investments as they jockey for federal aidThe world's top semiconductor makers have announced in recent months long-term U.S. investments that could rise to more than $400 billion, citing support from a new federal aid program for which the rules have yet to be written.Intel, Micron, IBM, Samsung, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and others say their plans to build or expand U.S. semiconductor fabrication facilities, or fabs, are at least in part dependent on getting federal grants.The companies' widely publicized announcements, with President Joe Biden participating in an Intel groundbreaking in Ohio and visiting an IBM plant in New York, are a sign of the political, economic and security motives that led Congress to enact a law in August meant to revive U.S. manufacturing of semiconductor chips.But the announcements also came months before the Commerce Department, which is managing almost $50 billion in grant money appropriated by the law, sets rules for diaibuting the aid. The department plans to begin taking applications in February, and the first grants aren't likely to be awarded until the early summer of 2024.The early announcements—and their size—have echoes of an event in 2018 in Wisconsin where President Donald Trump, Gov. Scott Walker and House Speaker Paul Ryan, R-Wis., joined Foxconn CEO Terry Gou to break ground on a $10 billion project to make flat-panel displays for TVs and smart phones. More than four years later, the company has reduced the project investment to a few hundred million dollars, citing weak demand and inadequate supplier base.The companies vying for chips grants haven't said how much they hope to get, or whether getting less than expected will change their investment plans, but they are counting on it."We've always been clear, with every announcement that we've made, the importance of CHIPS Act funding to carry them out," Al Thompson, Intel vice president for government relations, said in an interview. "One of the reasons why we were so out front and pushing to get the CHIPS Act funded was because of its importance to our investments in the U.S."Intel, in particular, has been vocal about the link between its investments and the grants. In June when legislation was stalled in Congress, CEO Pat Gelsinger warned that the company would go "slow and small or we're going to go big and bold based on the CHIPS Act."Intel said it could invest as much as $100 billion over the next decade to build one of the world's largest chip-making complexes in Ohio that may include as many as eight fabs, but the initial investment is about $20 billion. The company is also developing facilities in Arizona and New Mexico.Micron CEO Sanjay Mehrotra also attributed the company's early October announcement of a two-decade, $100 billion plan to build fabs in upstate New York to the law. "There is no doubt that without the CHIPS Act, we would not be here today," Mehrotra said while announcing the plans.Lawmakers and adminiaation officials say the legislation is meant to reverse the decline in U.S. chips manufacturing, to 11 percent of global fabrication capacity in 2019 from 40 percent in 1990. Taiwan's TSMC and South Korea's Samsung are the world's leading producers, and China is investing heavily to build capacity.The governments of those countries provided significant subsidies to help the companies build capacity.Setting up allocation auctureThe Commerce Department's National Institute of Standards and Technology has begun the work of figuring out how to allocate the grants by seeking information, including a request on Oct. 12 for comments from companies on how to aucture the program. The comments are due by Nov. 14. A department official said only that decisions on funding won't be made until it has evaluated applications.The current semiconductor effort differs from Foxconn's Wisconsin project in several ways. The semiconductor spending combines federal spending and tax incentives to support the entire supply chain, including long-term research. The Foxconn project was backed by state tax incentives to encourage job creation. It remains to be seen if federal assistance will reverse the decadeslong decline in semiconductor manufacturing.Semiconductor manufacturing typically requires economies of scale requiring companies to build significant capacity to drive down costs. TSMC and Samsung each operate multiple fabs with a monthly output of several million wafers or discs from which individual chips are made.The companies acknowledge their efforts now to shape the program to their advantage."Companies are now trying to look at what is the appropriate way to ensure that our applications include the criteria that the department is looking for in terms of workforce development, leveraging private capital, and we will be ready by February," Thompson said.Stephen Ezell, director of global innovation policy at the Information Technology and Innovation Foundation, or ITIF, said the grants won't affect whether company investments go ahead, but could affect their size."Intel has said that they have room for as many as eight fabs in Ohio, and TSMC has said five additional fabs may be possible in Arizona," Ezell said in an interview. "The investments are going to happen, but how truly big are these going to be" remains to be seen.ITIF was closely involved in working with Senate Majority Leader Charles E. Schumer and Sen. Todd Young, R-Ind., as they were crafting the funding legislation.The law aims to support not only global makers of semiconductors but also suppliers of materials, minerals, chemicals and equipment. In addition to grants, the agency also is seeking feedback on setting aside about $6 billion for loan guarantees that companies could use to raise as much as $75 billion.The Commerce Department's aategy—allocating the grants in three buckets—is also a factor that will determine which companies will be eligible for which parts of the funding:About $28 billion, or three-quarters of the incentive funding, would go toward establishing U.S. production of cutting-edge, high-end processing and memory chips. The money would be diaibuted through grants and loan guarantees not only to individual applicants but to consortia of manufacturers and suppliers.Another $10 billion of incentives would go toward fabs making "mature and current generation chips."The third bucket, about $11 billion that isn't considered incentive funding, would go for establishing research and development centers set up in collaboration with universities, companies and allies around the world.A separate portion of the law authorizes funding for research and applications in several high-tech areas such as quantum computing, artificial intelligence and biotechnology.The department has set up a 25-member induaial advisory board comprised of academics, induay and security experts to advise the agency on the program, and a CHIPS program office whose officials are based at the White House and the department will manage the effort.In addition to the nearly $50 billion in grants and loan guarantees, the law provides a temporary tax credit equal to 25 percent of the tax basis of a qualified property that is part of a chips manufacturing facility.The combination of grants and tax credit is key to achieving Intel's long-term vision of becoming a leading integrated device manufacturer, Thompson said. Unlike TSMC and Samsung, which only fabricate and manufacture chips designed by others such as Apple and Qualcomm, Intel designs its own chips and is now adding fabrication capacity.TSMC and Samsung's concern that the law would exclude foreign companies appears to have been allayed because the text doesn't distinguish between U.S. and foreign companies. TSMC is building a $12 billion facility in Arizona, and Samsung is developing a $17 billion fab in Texas and has said it could invest up to $200 billion to expand its facilities.Spreading aid too thinlyGiven the wide gap between potential investment and the nearly $50 billion in government aid, there's some worry that in trying to please everyone the Commerce Department may aetch it thin with each company getting only a small portion, said one induay executive, asking to speak anonymously in order not to alienate the department.But suppliers to major commercial fabs are likely to be smaller and require a smaller portion of the grant money, the executive said: "Not everything is a $10 billion or a $20 billion project."
abaact: 近日，世界顶级半导体制造商宣布了可能会获得美国超过4000亿美元的长期投资，该投资由美国新的联邦援助计划提供，不过具体的援助金额尚未确定。该计划的推行正处于《芯片法案》背景之下，是多个芯片制造商能获得援助的主要推手，并且该立法旨在扭转美国芯片制造业的下滑趋势。这些争夺芯片资助的公司尚未表明希望获得多少资金，但都信心满满。目前，美国商务部国家标准与技术研究所已经开始搜集信息来确定如何分配这项拨款。商务部的策略是将拨款分为三个阶段，以便更好的决定哪些公司有资格获相对应的资助。然而，美国联邦政府的援助是否会扭转半导体制造业长达数十年的下滑趋势，仍有待观察。目前，该部门已成立一个由25名成员组成的行业顾问委员会，就援助计划向研究所提供建议，并设立一个芯片计划办公室来专门管理这项工作。

title: 美国开发出一种声波剥离技术来降低半导体成本
keyword: 声波剥离技术 碳化硅 半导体设备 衬底 晶圆片
content_zh: Sonic Lift-off技术旨在降低半导体成本。半导体器件制造要求具有完美平坦和光滑表面的高质量晶圆。 晶圆表面的质量是确保高性能和可靠器件的基础。 为了降低器件的制造成本，必须防止杂质或表面不规则性的形成，这可能在最终组件中引入缺陷，并导致成本增加。Crystal Sonic公司正在开发一种基于声音功率的创新器件剥离和衬底再利用技术。目前，近50%的宽禁带(WBG)器件制造成本归因于衬底材料。 同时，WBG衬底晶圆需求也在增加，主要受汽车、太阳能逆变器、电机和风力逆变器等应用的驱动，尤其是碳化硅（SiC）的需求和可用性之间的差距预计将在未来几年扩大，潜在的SiC晶圆短缺风险。 在射频(RF)和汽车行业以及所有要求高功率密度、高效率、高开关频率和小尺寸的应用的推动下，对氮化镓（GaN）的需求也在快速增长。缩小这一差距的一个有希望的方法是通过衬底再利用技术。水晶声波的衬底再利用技术总部位于亚利桑那州凤凰城，是一家硬科技初创公司，成立于2018年，目标是降低成本和材料浪费，以生产下一代半导体。水晶声波的器件剥离和衬底再利用技术， 它在美国和日本拥有两项已授予和有效的专利（加上另一项正在申请的专利和三项准备中的额外专利申请），来自亚利桑那州立大学(ASU)的玛丽安娜·贝尔托尼教授的实验室。 贝尔托尼领导着能量转换技术缺陷工程（缺陷）实验室，专注于缺陷如何影响材料的电气和光学特性。这项被称为声波剥离的专利工艺，利用声波切割半导体器件制造中使用的单晶晶圆，防止浪费，节省资金。 与传统的研磨过程不同，传统的研磨过程昂贵、耗时，并会对表面和亚表面造成损害，Crystal Sonic的技术使用声音来切割和剥离薄器件层，留下高质量的表面，并可重复使用大块衬底。通过重复使用技术取代机械晶圆背磨，允许制造商将器件的晶圆成本贡献（约占总成本的50%）降低一半，并有可能通过多次重复使用将其降至零。据Crystal Sonic称，下一代半导体器件正在构建在SiC、GaN、砷化镓（GaAs）等衬底材料上。 这些材料生产更小、更有效和更高效的器件，为电力电子、传感、通信和其他领域开辟了新的可能性。由于其可靠性、效率和性能，WBG材料在市场上迅速增长，满足了电子迁移率、光伏、激光二极管、射频和医疗/消毒等大趋势的需求。音速升降装置减薄是后端制造过程中至关重要的一步。 传统的（既定的）方法是机械背磨，但使用效率低、耗时长、成本高（如前所述，整个器件制造成本的50%归因于晶圆），如图1所示，传统制造工作流程的第2步包括器件制造，而第3步是背磨（器件减薄），随后是划片和封装步骤。 在背磨过程中，传统的晶圆和器件减薄制造技术浪费了90%或更多的衬底材料，这些材料无法重复使用。迄今为止，Crystal Sonice已经成功地在小直径Si、GaAs、SiC、GaN和AlN晶圆上进行了演示和原型测试。 在厚度控制、低粗糙度表面和保持器件性能方面，所进行的测试取得了令人满意的结果。 此外，更相关的是，如图3所示，使用重复使用的衬底构建的器件的性能实际上与使用原始衬底相同。传统的晶圆背磨使用金刚石树脂结合剂砂轮来去除晶圆背面的半导体材料，从而降低晶圆厚度。 这是一个遗留下来的和既定的技术，但它是昂贵的，浪费和材料的再利用是不可能的。 除背磨外，目前还有化学(ELO)、机械（剥落）、激光剥离、智能切割（离子注入）和2DLT（远距离外延）等器件减薄技术。 虽然音速L
content_en: Sonic Lift-Off Tech Aims to Reduce Semiconductor CostsSemiconductor device manufacturing requires the availability of high-quality wafers with perfectly flat and smooth surfaces. The quality of a wafer’s surface is fundamental to ensuring high-performing and reliable devices. It is necessary to prevent the formation of impurities or surface irregularities that could introduce defects in the final component and lead to increased costs.An innovative device lift-off and subaate reuse technology based on the power of sound, under development at Crystal Sonic, Inc., aims to lower per-device manufacturing costs substantiallyToday, nearly 50% of wide bandgap (WBG) device manufacturing costs are attributed to the subaate material. At the same time, WBG subaate wafer demand is ramping up, mainly driven by applications including automotive, solar inverters, motor, and wind inverters, particularly for silicon carbide (SiC).The gap between demand and availability of wafers is expected to widen in the coming years, with the potential risk for SiC wafer shortages. The demand for gallium nitride (GaN) is also growing rapidly, driven by the radio frequency (RF) and automotive sectors, as well as by all applications that require high power density, high efficiency, high switching frequency and small dimensions.A promising way to close this gap is through subaate reuse technologies.Crystal Sonic’s subaate reuse techHeadquartered in Phoenix, Arizona, Crystal Sonic is a hard-tech startup founded in 2018 with the goal of reducing costs and material waste to produce next-gen semiconductors.Crystal Sonic’s device lift-off and subaate reuse tech, which holds two awarded and active patents in the U.S. and Japan (plus another patent pending and three additional patent filings in preparation), originates from Professor Mariana Bertoni’s laboratory at Arizona State University (ASU). Bertoni leads the Defect Engineering for Energy Conversion Technologies (DEfECT) lab, focusing on how defects can affect a material’s electrical and optical properties.The patented process, known as Sonic Lift-Off, uses sound waves to cut single crystal wafers used in semiconductor-based device fabrication, preventing waste, and saving money. Unlike the traditional grinding process, which is expensive, time consuming and introduces damage to surfaces and sub-surfaces, Crystal Sonic’s tech uses sound to cut and lift-off thin device layers, leaving high quality surfaces behind and the bulk subaate available for reuse.By replacing mechanical wafer backgrinding with reuse tech, allowing manufacturers to reduce the device’s wafer cost contribution (approximately 50% of total cost) by half and potentially towards zero with multiple reuses.According to Crystal Sonic, next-gen semiconductor devices are being built on subaate materials like SiC, GaN, gallium arsenide (GaAs) and others. These materials produce smaller, more effective and more efficient devices, opening new possibilities for power electronics, sensing, communications and other fields.Due to their reliability, efficiency and performance, WBG materials are rapidly growing in the market, meeting demand from megatrends like e-mobility, photovoltaics, laser diode, radio frequency and healthcare/disinfection.Sonic Lift-OffDevice thinning is a crucial step in the manufacturing processes at the back end. The traditional (established) method is mechanical backgrinding, but it is inefficient, time-consuming and expensive to use (as mentioned before, 50% of the overall device manufacturing cost is attributed to the wafer).As shown in Figure 1, Step 2 of the conventional manufacturing workflow consists in the device fabrication, while Step 3 is the backgrinding (device thinning), followed by the dicing and packaging steps. During backgrinding, legacy manufacturing techniques for wafering and device thinning waste 90% or more of the subaate material, which cannot be reused.To date, Crystal Sonice has successful performed demos and prototype testing on small diameter Si, GaAs, SiC, GaN and AlN wafers. The tests performed produced satisfactory results in terms of thickness control, low-roughness surfaces, and preserved device performance. Moreover—which is even more relevant and depicted in Figure 3—the performance of the device built with reused subaate is practically the same as with the original subaate.Traditional wafer backgrinding reduces the wafer thickness using a diamond-resin bonded grinding wheel to remove the semiconductor material from the back of a wafer. This is a legacy and established technique, but it is costly, wasteful and reuse of material is not possible. Moreover, it requires deionized water to wash debris from the surface and prevent contamination.Besides backgrinding, other device thinning methods are currently available, such as the chemical (ELO), mechanical (spalling), laser Lift-Off, smart cut (ion implantation), and 2DLT (remote epitaxy) techniques. Though Sonic Lift-Off is still under development, the solution (also known as acoustic spalling) is the only one able to provide the following characteristics:Tunable lift-off thickness,Fast, scalable process,High-quality surfaces,Multiple reuses andMultiple subaate types.Regarding the sub-surface damage, Sonic Lift-Off provides low roughness (Ra < 1 ?m, to date), minimal or no sub-surface damage, can maintain off-cut angle (due to acoustic control), is a gentler and material-efficient process, and allows reuse of multiple subaates.“Reusability allows device manufacturers to reclaim the most expensive part of the device manufacturing process, which in turn drives down the cost of next generation semiconductor devices,” according to Crystal Sonic.
abaact: 近日，美国Crystal Sonic正在开发一种声波剥离技术将碳化硅(SiC)晶体等切割成衬底片，由此来减少切割产生的材料浪费，从而大幅节省成本。通常，在制作碳化硅芯片时，由于碳化硅衬底太硬，使用传统切割打磨技术会浪费90%或更多的衬底材料。该公司利用声波剥离技术来将碳化硅等衬底从晶圆片中分离，可以让其留下高质量的表面，实现大块基板可重复使用。这种方法速度快，不浪费材料，并能保持微米级精度的高质量表面。截至目前，该公司已经成功地对小直径硅、砷化镓、碳化硅、氮化镓和氮化铝晶圆进行了演示和原型测试。结果显示，使用声波剥离的衬底构建的器件在性能上与原始衬底相同。该研究让降低下一代半导体设备成本成为可能，拓展了碳化硅和氮化镓在汽车行业、太阳能逆变器、电机和风能逆变器等方面的应用范围。

title: 微软将类似ChatGPT的技术植入搜索引擎必应
keyword: 微软 ChatGPT 搜索引擎 必应
content_zh: 微软将Chatgpt类技术融入搜索引擎BingMicrosoft正在将Chatgpt类技术融入其搜索引擎Bing，将一项现在远远落后于谷歌的互联网服务转变为一种与人工智能沟通的新方式。微软第二大搜索引擎的改造可能会让这家软件巨头在利用全球围绕Chatgpt的兴奋方面领先于其他科技公司，Chatgpt是一种让数百万人意识到最新人工智能技术可能性的工具。除了将Chatgpt添加到Bing中，微软还将Chatbot技术集成到其Edge浏览器中。 微软周二在华盛顿州雷德蒙总部的一次活动中宣布了这项新技术。微软消费者部门负责人优素福·迈赫迪（Yusuf Mehdi）在接受采访时表示，“认为它比ChatGPT更快、更准确、更强大”，后者使用ChatGPT制造商OpenAI的技术构建，但针对搜索查询进行了调整。周二，新的必应面向注册的桌面用户发布了公开预览，但迈赫迪表示，这项技术将在未来几周扩大到数百万用户，并最终将出现在必应和Edge的智能手机应用程序中。 他说，目前，每个人都可以尝试有限数量的查询。与OpenAI的加强伙伴关系已经酝酿了多年，首先是微软在2019年投资10亿美元，开发了一台功能强大的超级计算机，专门为训练这家旧金山初创公司的人工智能模型而建。虽然这并不总是事实或逻辑的，但ChatGPT对语言和语法的掌握来自于摄入了大量数字化书籍、维基百科条目、指导手册， 报纸和其他在线文章。微软公司首席执行官萨蒂亚·纳德拉（Satya Nadella）周二表示，新的人工智能进步“将重塑我们所知的每一个软件类别”，包括搜索，就像早期个人电脑和云计算的创新一样。 他说，开发人工智能很重要，“要符合人类的偏好和社会规范，你不能在实验室里这样做。你必须在世界上这样做。”向让搜索引擎更具对话性--能够自信地回答问题，而不是提供其他网站的链接--的转变可能会改变广告推动的搜索业务，但如果人工智能系统不能正确处理事实，也会带来风险。 尽管新的必应包含了引用原始数据的注释，但它们的不透明性也使得它们很难返回到他们有效记忆的原始人造图像和文本。“必应是由人工智能驱动的，所以惊喜和错误是可能的，”这是一条出现在必应新主页预览版底部的信息。 “一定要检查事实。”作为它是如何工作的一个例子，迈赫迪要求新的必应比较最有影响力的墨西哥画家，它提供了典型的搜索结果，但在页面的右侧，还编辑了一个事实框，总结了迭戈·里维拉、弗里达·卡罗和何塞·克莱门特·奥罗斯科的细节。 在另一个例子中，他在20世纪90年代的说唱节目中测试了它，展示了它区分克里斯·克罗斯的歌曲《跳跃》和痛苦之家的歌曲《跳来跳去》的能力。 他用它来展示它如何计划假期或帮助购物。高德纳分析师杰森·王（Jason Wong）表示，新的技术进步将缓解导致微软2016年灾难性推出实验性聊天机器人Tay的原因，用户训练该机器人发表种族主义和性别歧视言论。 但王表示，如果必应提供的答案准确性低或所谓的人工智能“幻觉”混淆了数据，微软“声誉风险仍将是首要问题”。谷歌对此类举措一直持谨慎态度。 但为了应对ChatGPT受欢迎的压力，谷歌首席执行官桑达尔·皮查伊（Sundar Pichai）周一宣布了一项名为Bard的新对话服务，该服务将在今年晚些时候广泛发布之前只向一群“可信的测试者”提供。王说，谷歌对ChatGPT的成功感到措手不及，但在面向消费者的技术方面仍比微软有优势，而微软在向企业销售产品方面有优势。据中国媒体报道，中国科技巨头百度本周也宣布了一款类似的搜索聊天机器人，将于今年晚些时候推出。 脸书母公司Meta和亚马逊等其他科技竞争对手一直在研究类似的技术，但微软的最新举措旨在将其置于ChatGPT时代的中心。微软今年1月透露，它将向OpenAI，再投入数十亿美元，因为它希望将ChatGPT、图像生成器Dall-E和其他OpenAI创新背后的技术融合到与其云计算平台以及电子邮件和电子表格等办公产品套件相关的一系列微软产品中。最令人惊讶的可能是与必应的集成， 它是许多市场上排名第二的搜索引擎，但从未接近挑战谷歌的
content_en: Microsoft bakes ChatGPT-like tech into search engine BingMicrosoft is fusing ChatGPT-like technology into its search engine Bing, transforming an internet service that now trails far behind Google into a new way of communicating with artificial intelligence.The revamping of Microsoft's second-place search engine could give the software giant a head start against other tech companies in capitalizing on the worldwide excitement surrounding ChatGPT, a tool that's awakened millions of people to the possibilities of the latest AI technology.Along with adding it to Bing, Microsoft is also integrating the chatbot technology into its Edge browser. Microsoft announced the new technology at an event Tuesday at its headquarters in Redmond, Washington."Think of it as faster, more accurate, more powerful" than ChatGPT, built with technology from ChatGPT-maker OpenAI but tuned for search queries, said Yusuf Mehdi, a Microsoft executive who leads its consumer division, in an interview.A public preview of the new Bing launched Tuesday for desktop users who sign up for it, but Mehdi said the technology will scale to millions of users in coming weeks and will eventually come to the smartphone apps for Bing and Edge. For now, everyone can try a limited number of queries, he said.The aengthening partnership with OpenAI has been years in the making, starting with a $1 billion investment from Microsoft in 2019 that led to the development of a powerful supercomputer specifically built to train the San Francisco startup's AI models.While it's not always factual or logical, ChatGPT's mastery of language and grammar comes from having ingested a huge trove of digitized books, Wikipedia entries, inauction manuals, newspapers and other online writings.Microsoft Corp. CEO Satya Nadella said Tuesday that new AI advances are "going to reshape every software category we know," including search, much like earlier innovations in personal computers and cloud computing. He said it is important to develop AI "with human preferences and societal norms and you're not going to do that in a lab. You have to do that out in the world."The shift to making search engines more conversational—able to confidently answer questions rather than offering links to other websites—could change the advertising-fueled search business, but also poses risks if the AI systems don't get their facts right. Their opaqueness also makes it hard to source back to the original human-made images and texts they've effectively memorized, though the new Bing includes annotations that reference the source data."Bing is powered by AI, so surprises and mistakes are possible," is a message that appears at the bottom of the preview version of Bing's new homepage. "Make sure to check the facts."As an example of how it works, Mehdi asked the new Bing to compare the most influential Mexican painters and it provided typical search results, but also, on the right side of the page, compiled a fact box summarizing details about Diego Rivera, Frida Kahlo and Jose Clemente Orozco. In another example, he quizzed it on 1990s-era rap, showing its ability to distinguish between the song "Jump" by Kris Kross and "Jump Around" by House of Pain. And he used it to show how it could plan a vacation or help with shopping.Gartner analyst Jason Wong said new technological advancements will mitigate what led to Microsoft's disaaous 2016 launch of the experimental chatbot Tay, which users trained to spout racist and sexist remarks. But Wong said "reputational risks will still be at the forefront" for Microsoft if Bing produces answers with low accuracy or so-called AI "hallucinations" that mix and conflate data.Google has been cautious about such moves. But in response to pressure over ChatGPT's popularity, Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Monday announced a new conversational service named Bard that will be available exclusively to a group of "trusted testers" before being widely released later this year.Wong said Google was caught off-guard with the success of ChatGPT but still has the advantage over Microsoft in consumer-facing technology, while Microsoft has the edge in selling its products to businesses.Chinese tech giant Baidu also this week announced a similar search chatbot coming later this year, according to Chinese media. Other tech rivals such as Facebook parent Meta and Amazon have been researching similar technology, but Microsoft's latest moves aim to position it at the center of the ChatGPT zeitgeist.Microsoft disclosed in January that it was pouring billions more dollars into OpenAI as it looks to fuse the technology behind ChatGPT, the image-generator DALL-E and other OpenAI innovations into an array of Microsoft products tied to its cloud computing platform and its Office suite of workplace products like email and spreadsheets.The most surprising might be the integration with Bing, which is the second-place search engine in many markets but has never come close to challenging Google's dominant position.Bing launched in 2009 as a rebranding of Microsoft's earlier search engines and was run for a time by Nadella, years before he took over as CEO. Its significance was boosted when Yahoo and Microsoft signed a deal for Bing to power Yahoo's search engine, giving Microsoft access to Yahoo's greater search share. Similar deals infused Bing into the search features for devices made by other companies, though users wouldn't necessarily know that Microsoft was powering their searches.By making it a destination for ChatGPT-like conversations, Microsoft could invite more users to give Bing a try, though the new version so far is limited to desktops and doesn't yet have an interface for smartphones—where most people now access the internet.On the surface, at least, a Bing integration seems far different from what OpenAI has in mind for its technology. Appearing at Microsoft's event, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said the "the new Bing experience looks fantastic" and is based in part on learnings from its GPT line of large language models. He said a key reason for his startup's Microsoft partnership is to help get OpenAI technology "into the hands of millions of people."OpenAI has long voiced an ambitious vision for safely guiding what's known as AGI, or artificial general intelligence, a not-yet-realized concept that harkens back to ideas from science fiction about human-like machines. OpenAI's website describes AGI as "highly autonomous systems that outperform humans at most economically valuable work."OpenAI started out as a nonprofit research laboratory when it launched in December 2015 with backing from Tesla CEO Elon Musk and others. Its stated aims were to "advance digital intelligence in the way that is most likely to benefit humanity as a whole, unconaained by a need to generate financial return."That changed in 2018 when it incorporated a for-profit business Open AI LP, and shifted nearly all its staff into the business, not long after releasing its first generation of the GPT model for generating human-like paragraphs of readable text.OpenAI's other products include the image-generator DALL-E, first released in 2021, the computer programming assistant Codex and the speech recognition tool Whisper.
abaact: 近日，微软正在将类似ChatGPT的技术融合到其搜索引擎必应中，将目前远远落后于谷歌的互联网服务转变为一种与人工智能交流的新方式。除了添加到必应，微软还将聊天机器人技术集成到Edge浏览器中。微软负责消费者部门的高管迈赫迪(Yusuf Mehdi)表示，周二已经向注册的台式机用户发布了新必应的公开预览版，该技术有望在未来几周扩展到数百万用户。通过在必应中使用ChatGPT，微软可以邀请更多的用户尝试必应，尽管到目前为止，新版本仅限于在台式机中使用，还没有智能手机接口。OpenAI首席执行官Sam Altman在微软的发布会上表示，新的必应体验看起来非常棒，他的初创公司与微软合作的一个关键原因是帮助OpenAI技术进入每一个人的手中。

title: 英国开发出用于精确剂量测定的一次性环保传感器
keyword: 紫外线剂量计 紫外线传感器 瞬态电子产品 剂量测定
content_zh: 用于精确可穿戴剂量的一次性、环保传感器来自光电进展的新出版物讨论了基于纳米线的可降解高性能光电探测器用于环保绿色电子。传感器负载可穿戴系统在广泛的应用中有很大的希望，包括健康监测、康复、机器人电子皮肤、环境监测、物联网（IoT）等。通常这些应用需要成本有效的一次性传感器用于短期或单次测量。 可穿戴设备中的一次性传感器也有助于克服与可清洗性相关的典型挑战。同样，一次性传感器有助于解决健康监测应用中的卫生要求。 在这些需求的推动下，Dahiya教授和他的同事们提出了基于ZnO纳米线的高性能紫外(UV)光电探测器。 研制的可穿戴、一次性装置能准确测量紫外光强度。 选择了传感材料（ZnO纳米线）和衬底材料（壳聚糖），使该器件在洗涤传感器集成的衣服时在水中无害地降解。 以壳聚糖为基质的ZnO纳米线具有优异的化学稳定性、良好的光学透明性、较大的机械柔韧性和良好的生物降解性，同样，ZnO纳米线具有显著的优点，如(i)成本有效的合成，(ii)对紫外光高度敏感，(iii)环境友好，(iv)生物相容性和(v)生物降解性。 此外，用于一次性传感器的制造步骤是环保的、可扩展的和资源高效的。 其中包括壳聚糖基绿色基片的简易合成，氧化锌纳米线的喷涂，以及丝网印刷实现接触电极。 因此，无论是在传感器的开发过程中还是在其寿命结束时，都会产生微不足道的电子废物。由Ravinder Dahiya教授领导的可弯曲电子和传感技术(BEST)研究小组提出了生态友好的材料和资源高效的制造路线来开发可穿戴紫外线(UV)剂量计，这些剂量计在使用后可以安全地处理，因此不会对环境造成不利影响。不受控制的紫外线辐射暴露是皮肤癌的主要原因。 过度暴露还会损害基因的DNA，从而损害皮肤细胞的生长。 到达地球表面的紫外线辐射量因地区而异。 季节性紫外线强度波动、辐射泄漏和不同的地理位置使得紫外线检测相当具有挑战性。 人们对便携式紫外传感器的开发进行了大量的研究，这些传感器具有新颖的形状，包括柔性和/或可拉伸性。因此，许多可穿戴和一次性消费紫外传感器已经开发出来，并在市场上上市。 然而，可处置性并不一定意味着可生物降解性，这就是许多报告的设备达不到预期的地方，也没有充分解决日益严重的电子废物问题。 Dahiya教授和他的同事们提出了高性能的一次性可穿戴光电探测器，在制造过程中和寿命结束后都不会对环境产生不利影响。我们的环境在不断发展。 为子孙后代保护环境是我们的责任。 目前，我们面临着许多具有挑战性的环境问题。 其中很少一部分，如电子垃圾或电子废物，需要紧急关注以保护生态系统。 电子废物由废弃的电子设备组成，是当今世界面临的重要环境问题之一。成本下降的趋势，以及我们日常活动对资讯及通讯科技设备的需求日益增长，导致消费电子设备的使用量增加。 这导致了全球范围内电子垃圾的无与伦比的增长。 例如，2019年，我们产生了5360万吨电子垃圾。 新冠肺炎疫情进一步推动了“电子垃圾海啸”，这导致虚拟工作成为新的规范。 电子垃圾的处理、再利用和回收需要大量的资源。 此外，大量的化学废物（例如，在光刻和化学蚀刻等过程中）是目前在电子发展过程中产生的。 考虑到这些方面，Dahiya教授和他的团队提出了一套生态友好的材料来开发瞬态紫外传感器，这些传感器在使用后物理上消失。 可持续材料的使用和零废物或低废物的制造工艺将引发对瞬态电子学的进一步研究，并有助于减少电子对环境的不利影响。开发的高性能、适形和一次性
content_en: Disposable, eco-friendly sensors for precise wearable dosimetryA new publication from Opto-Electronic Advances discusses nanowires based degradable high-performance photodetectors for eco-friendly green electronics.Sensor laden wearable systems hold great promise for wide range of applications including health monitoring, rehabilitation, electronic skin in robotics, environment monitoring, Internet of Things (IoT) etc. Often these applications, require cost-effective disposable sensors either for short-term or for single measurements. Single use sensors in wearables could also help overcome the typical challenges related to washability.Likewise, disposable sensors could help address the hygiene requirements in health monitoring applications. Motivated by these requirements, Prof. Dahiya, and co-workers present ZnO nanowires based high-performance ultraviolet (UV) photodetectors on flexible, biodegradable subaate. The developed wearable, disposable device can accurately measure the UV light intensity. The sensing (ZnO nanowires) and subaate (chitosan) materials were selected to allow the device to harmlessly degrade in water during washing of sensors-integrated clothes. Chitosan as the subaate offers excellent chemical stability, good optical transparency, greater mechanical flexibility, and excellent biodegradability.Similarly, the ZnO nanowires offer distinct advantages, such as (i) cost-effective synthesis, (ii) highly sensitive to UV light, (iii) environmental friendliness, (iv) biocompatibility and (v) biodegradability. Further, the fabrication steps used for disposable sensors are eco-friendly, scalable, and resource efficient. These include facile synthesis of chitosan based green subaates, spray coating of ZnO nanowires, and screen printing to realize contact electrodes. Thus, both during the development of sensors and the end of its life, negligible electronic waste is generated.The Bendable Electronics and Sensing Technologies (BEST) research group, led by Prof. Ravinder Dahiya presents eco-friendly materials and resource-efficient fabrication route to develop wearable ultraviolet (UV) dosimeters, which can be safely disposed after their use and thus cause no adverse impact onto environment.Uncontrolled exposure to UV radiation is a major cause for skin cancer. The excess exposure could also damage the DNA of genes and hence the skin cell growth. The amount of UV radiation reaching on earth surface varies from region to region. The seasonal UV intensity fluctuations, radiation leaks and diverse geographical locations make UV detection quite challenging. Significant research efforts have been made for the development of portable UV sensors, with novel form factors including flexible and/or aetchable.Accordingly, many wearable and disposable consumer UV sensors have already been developed and are available in the market. However, disposability does not necessarily mean biodegradability, and this is where many of the reported devices fall short of expectations and do not fully address the growing issue of electronic waste (E-waste). Prof. Dahiya and co-workers present high performance disposable, wearable photodetectors having no adverse environmental impact during their fabrication as well as after the end of life.Our environment is constantly evolving. It is our duty to preserve the environment for future generations. Currently, we are facing many kinds of challenging environmental problems. Few of these such as electronic waste or e-waster need urgent attention to preserve the ecosystem. E-waste constitutes of junked electronic gadgets and is one of the crucial current environmental problems that the world is facing.The descending trend in cost and growing needs of ICT gadgets to perform our day-to-day activities, are leading to an increase in use of consumer electronic devices. This has led to an unparalleled growth of E-waste worldwide. For instance, in 2019, we generated a massive 53.6 million tons of E-waste. The "tsunami of E-waste" is further fueled by the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic which has led to virtual working becoming the new norm. Significant resources are needed for disposal, reuse, and recycling of E-waste. Further, large chemical waste (e.g., during photolithography and chemical etching etc.) is currently generated during the development of electronics. Thus, attention is needed both during the development of electronics and after the end of life to alleviate the serious threat we face for the environment sustainability.Considering these aspects, Prof. Dahiya and his group have come up with an eco-friendly set of materials to develop transient UV sensors which physically disappear after their use. The use of sustainable materials and zero or low-waste fabrication processes in this work would trigger further research on transient electronics and help reduce the adverse environmental impact of electronics.The developed high performance, conformal, and disposable photodetectors have been demonaated to monitor exposure to UV radiations which is considered as one of the main risk factors to develop nonmelanoma and melanoma skin cancers. Further, the device could be integrated over nonplanar surfaces such as clothes or skin for wearable dosimetry. Such wearable and disposable patches can be used for real-time monitoring of UV radiation under diverse environmental conditions such as mountaineering activities. Lastly, such disposable and flexible UV photodetectors are critical for secure communication and environmental monitoring applications.
abaact: 近日，由英国格拉斯哥大学领导的研究团队利用生态友好材料和资源，开发出了一种基于传感器的可穿戴紫外线剂量计，剂量计在使用后能够得到安全处理而不会对环境产生负面影响。目前，市场上许多可穿戴和一次性紫外线传感器设备不具有可生物降解特性，为了从根本上解决电子垃圾对环境造成的污染，研究团队使用了一套环保材料开发瞬态紫外线传感器，这些传感器会在使用后会降解消失。研究中使用的可持续材料和零废物或低废物制造工艺将引领对瞬态电子产品的进一步研究，有助于减少电子产品对环境的不利影响。此外，该设备可以集成在非平面表面上，更利于可穿戴剂量测定和在各种环境下实时监测紫外线辐射。最后，这种灵活的一次性紫外线传感器对于安全通信和环境监测应用具有重要作用。

title: 俄罗斯开发出使用纳米粒子的净水修复方法
keyword: 氧化锡纳米颗粒 光催化剂 有机化合物
content_zh: 化学导航：科学家利用纳米粒子开发一种水修复方法来自圣彼得堡大学的化学家开发了一种利用氧化锡纳米粒子基光催化剂从有机化合物中净化水的方法。 这项研究的结果发表在《合金与化合物杂志》上。水污染是一个严重的环境问题。 由于工业的高速发展和废水量的增加，水体的生态正在恶化。 因此，科学家们正在努力开发新的方法来处理工业排放物，以快速和没有不必要的废物来净化复杂的污染物，如有机染料。光催化是废水处理技术中最有前途的方法之一。 这是一个利用光能引发化学反应的过程，通过催化剂--一种以纳米颗粒形式存在的特殊材料--将有机化合物分解为二氧化碳和水。 到目前为止，人们还不知道究竟是什么决定了这种提纯的效率和速度：颗粒的大小，它们的结构特征或组成。 圣彼得堡大学的研究人员找到了这个问题的答案。圣彼得堡大学的化学家提出了一种系统的方法，将特定的污染物与纳米颗粒相匹配，用于光催化净水装置。 所开发的材料在暴露于普通二极管灯的可见光下时表现出光催化活性，在各方面都比以前使用的紫外线灯更便宜和更容易操作。“我们提供了一种全新的方法，可以比作道路导航系统。 例如，在选择前往目的地的路线时，你可以使用普通的纸质地图，根据路标和情况实时绘制路线。“我们提出了一种类似于现代导航系统的算法，对于任何想要的目的地，都会处理几个路线选项，分析当前交通情况，并选择最短的路线。 该项目的首席研究员、圣彼得堡大学普通和无机化学系的早期职业研究员阿纳斯塔西娅·波杜雷特说：“以前光催化剂的材料几乎是随机选择的，今天这个过程变得深思熟虑和有根据。”使用了基于含有三种元素（钴、镍、铜）的二氧化锡的纳米颗粒。 纳米粒子和纳米材料合成与研究团队对不同条件下纳米粒子的形成过程和光催化分解污染物的产物进行了大规模的研究，发现为了制造有效的催化剂，必须以这样的方式组织其合成，即形成一个具有最大数量的氧空位的固体体--当没有单个原子时，晶格缺陷。 正是空位使新出现的电子-空穴对转移到纳米颗粒表面，在那里它们在破坏污染物分子中起着主要作用。 重要的是不要有太多的其他缺陷，否则结果会相反。 这种方法已经被广泛使用的有机染料亚甲蓝和抗生素土霉素证明。利用纳米颗粒修复水的方法的研究也发表在《材料化学和物理》和《危险材料杂志》上。除了光催化之外，科学家们还利用大肠杆菌证明了合成的纳米颗粒的抗菌活性。 由于破坏有机分子的机制与中和细菌的机制相似，有效的光催化剂也能够破坏相应的细菌。研究人员表示，这种方法也适用于其他污染物：需要特殊的计算来理解如何改变纳米颗粒对不同污染物的参数。
content_en: Chemical navigation: Scientists develop a water remediation method using nanoparticlesChemists from St Petersburg University have developed a method for purifying water from organic compounds using tin oxide nanoparticle based photocatalysts. The findings of the research are published in the Journal of Alloys and Compounds .Water pollution is an acute environmental issue. Due to the high rate of induaial development and increasing volumes of wastewater, the ecology of water bodies is deteriorating. Scientists are therefore working hard to develop new ways of treating induaial discharges that would quickly and without unnecessary waste purify water from complex pollutants such as organic dyes.One of the most promising approaches in wastewater treatment technology to purify water is to use photocatalysis. It is a process in which light energy is used to trigger chemical reactions to break down organic compounds into carbon dioxide and water through the presence of a catalyst—a special material in the form of nanoparticles. Until now, there has been no understanding of what exactly determines the efficiency and speed of such purification: the size of the particles, the features of their aucture or their composition. The researchers from St Petersburg University have found the answer to this question.The chemists from St Petersburg University proposed a systematic approach to matching a particular pollutant with nanoparticles for use in photocatalytic water purification units. The materials developed exhibit photocatalytic activity when exposed to visible light from ordinary diode lamps, which in all respects are cheaper and easier to operate than the ultraviolet ones used previously."We offer a fundamentally new approach, which can be compared to a road navigation system. For example, you can use an ordinary paper map when choosing a route to your destination, plotting your route yourself in real time, guided by road signs and the situation."We propose an algorithm similar to modern navigation systems which, for any desired destination, process several route options, analyze the current traffic situation and select the shortest route. Whereas previously the materials for photocatalysts were chosen almost at random, today this process is becoming thoughtful and well-founded," said Anastasiia Podurets, principal investigator of the project and an early career researcher in the Department of General and Inorganic Chemiay at St Petersburg University.Nanoparticles based on tin dioxide containing three elements (cobalt, nickel, copper) were used. The research team of synthesis and research of nanoparticles and nanoauctured materials carried out a large-scale study of nanoparticles formation processes and products of photocatalytic decomposition of pollutants under different conditions.The scientists have found out that in order to create an effective catalyst, it is necessary to organize its synthesis in such a way that a solid body with the maximum number of oxygen vacancies—lattice defects when there are no individual atoms in it—is formed. It is the vacancies that allow the emerging electron-hole pairs to be transferred to the surface of nanoparticles, where they play a major role in the deauction of pollutant molecules. It is important not to have too many other defects, otherwise the result will be the opposite. The approach developed has been proven with the widely used organic dye methylene blue and the antibiotic oxytetracycline.Studies on water remediation methods using nanoparticles have also been published in the journals Materials Chemiay and Physics and Journal of Hazardous Materials.In addition to photocatalysis, the scientists demonaated the antibacterial activity of the synthesized nanoparticles using E. coli bacteria. As the mechanisms of deauction of organic molecules are similar to those used for neutralizing bacteria, effective photocatalysts are also capable of deaoying the corresponding bacteria.The researchers say that this method is also applicable to other pollutants: Special calculations are needed to understand how to change the parameters of nanoparticles against different pollutants.
abaact: 近日，俄罗斯圣彼得堡大学的化学家使用基于氧化锡纳米颗粒的光催化剂从有机化合物中开发出可以净化水的方法。目前，水污染一直是一个严重的环境问题，因此科学家们正在努力开发出能从有机染料等复杂污染物中找到净化水资源的方法。该团队所提出的系统方法正好可以达到这个效果。研究人员通过将特定污染物与纳米颗粒相匹配，再作用于光催化净水装置以达到净化水资源的目的。实验中，研究人员使用了基于含有钴、镍、铜三种元素在内的二氧化锡纳米颗粒进行研究。研究发现，想要创造一种有效的催化剂，需要将其进行有组织的合成，即形成具有最大数量氧空位的固体才能达到净化水的目的。除了光催化作用，科学家们还使用大肠杆菌证明了合成纳米粒子的抗菌活性。该研究首次实现了利用纳米技术来净化水资源，促进了水资源的保护。

title: 俄罗斯实现了将有毒杂草转化为钠离子电池的阳极材料
keyword: 有毒杂草 钠离子电池 阳极材料 风力发电
content_zh: 科学家用有毒的猪草为风能农场制造廉价钠离子电池的阳极材料MSU和Skoltech的研究人员已经将一种讨厌的有毒杂草转化为钠离子电池的高级阳极材料。 这是一种新兴的锂离子电池的更便宜的替代品，用于紧凑尺寸不重要的用途，如太阳能和风电场。 这项研究发表在《电池》杂志上。该研究的合著者、莫斯科国立罗蒙诺索夫大学的卓娅·博比列娃评论说：“我们想，把猪草这样令人讨厌的东西拿来做有用的东西，难道不是很有趣吗？” “用于钠离子电池阳极的硬碳材料的问题是，你可以用几乎任何来源的生物质制造它们。以前没有人考虑过猪草。但事实证明很好。”索斯诺斯基的猪草是一种入侵植物，会导致严重的皮肤烧伤。 最初作为一种实验性饲料作物从高加索进口到俄罗斯中部，但很快失去了控制，根据Skoltech研究人员的预测，到21世纪中期，它有可能蔓延到该国的整个欧洲地区。钠离子电池是一种替代性的储电技术，避免使用锂，锂主要集中在少数几个国家，越来越昂贵，生产中也不环保。 然而，如果电池使用钠离子而不是锂离子，则必须在正极和负极中使用完全不同的材料。 不久前，Skoltech的研究人员提出了一种性能出众的正极材料。 这一次，该研究所和MSU的另一个研究小组提出了一种高质量的阳极材料，其来源相当不可能。“截至目前，硬碳为钠离子电池阳极提供了最佳的性能组合。 它是一种无定形的碳，即使暴露在非常高的温度下也不会转化为石墨。 与石墨不同，它的结构可以容纳钠离子并在多次循环中释放它们，这对电池运行至关重要，而且充电时它的尺寸不会显著扩大。 它还便宜，合理地易于合成和处理，并且不会造成重大火灾危险。 这项研究的首席研究员、Skoltech和MSU的叶夫根尼·安蒂波夫教授说。MSU-Skoltech团队生产的硬碳表现出87%的库仑效率，与其他原料合成的硬碳的最佳报告结果持平。 这种特性反映了一种材料储存能量的能力，而不会将能量浪费在不必要的、不可逆的二次过程中，这实际上会损害电池。 至于能量储存能力，约为260毫安时/克，这种材料低于其他地方报道的最佳结果--约300毫安时/克--但仍然相当好。“事实上，我们既考虑了安全收割的冬季猪草，也考虑了盛开的讨厌的夏季猪草。 我不想告诉你，但是夏天收集的样品证明在最终产品的库仑效率方面更好，这是我们在本研究中强调的特征，因为它往往是硬碳阳极的弱点。 至于能量储存能力，我们有可能在以后提高它，“Bobyleva补充说。该团队测试了三种常见的硬碳合成方法。 首先是直接碳化：在没有氧气的气氛中将生物质加热到1300摄氏度。 或者，你可以用酸处理生物质，在碳化之前去除金属和其他杂质。 这种方法得到了明显更高的库仑效率。 或者你可以在一个封闭的反应器里把猪草生物量放在水中煮沸--这会产生非常小的含碳球。 虽然这三种方法都导致了可比的储能能力，但预先去除杂质的热处理导致了最佳的库仑效率。“对可充电蓄电池的需求将继续增长。当涉及到部署在工业设施和可再生能源生产中以平衡可用阳光或风力波动的固定式电池时，钠离子技术似乎非常有希望。这些电池将会便宜得多，尽管它们可能会更重更笨重，但对相关应用来说不会有太大问题，”研究合著者阿特姆·阿巴库莫夫教授说； 他是Skoltech能源科学和技术中心的负责人。
content_en: Scientists use toxic hogweed to make anode material for cheap sodium-ion batteries for wind farmsResearchers from MSU and Skoltech have transmuted a pesky poisonous weed into high-grade anode material for sodium-ion batteries. These are an emerging cheaper alternative to lithium-ion batteries for uses where compact size is not crucial, such as on solar and wind farms. The study was published in Batteries."We thought, wouldn't it be fun to take something as nasty and objectionable as hogweed and make something useful out of it," study co-author Zoya Bobyleva of Lomonosov Moscow State University commented. "The thing about hard carbon materials, used in sodium-ion battery anodes, is you can make them from biomass of virtually any origin. No one has considered hogweed before. But it turned out pretty well."Sosnowsky's hogweed is an invasive plant that causes severe skin burns. Originally imported to central Russia from Caucasus as an experimental forage crop, it quickly got out of control and, according to forecasts by Skoltech researchers, is threatening to spread over the entire European part of the country by the mid-21st century.Sodium-ion batteries are an alternative technology for power storage that avoids using lithium, which is largely concentrated in a select few countries, is becoming increasingly expensive, and is not environmentally friendly in production. If a battery uses sodium ions instead of lithium ions, however, completely different materials have to be used in the cathode and anode. Not long ago, Skoltech researchers proposed a cathode material with outstanding properties. This time, another research group based at the Institute and MSU, came up with a high-quality anode material derived from a fairly unlikely source."As of today, hard carbon offers the best combination of properties for a sodium-ion battery anode. It's an amorphous form of carbon that does not transform into graphite even when exposed to very high temperatures. Unlike graphite, its aucture can accommodate sodium ions and release them over many cycles, which is crucial for battery operation, and it does not significantly expand in size upon charge-up. It is also cheap, reasonably easy to synthesize and dispose of, and does not create significant fire hazards. The two key figures of merit here are Coulombic efficiency and energy storage capacity," the study's principal investigator, Professor Evgeny Antipov of Skoltech and MSU, said.The hard carbon produced by the MSU-Skoltech team exhibited a Coulombic efficiency of 87%, which is on par with the best reported results for hard carbons synthesized from other raw materials. That characteristic reflects how well a material stores energy without wasting it on unwanted irreversible secondary processes that actually harm the battery. As for the energy storage capacity, at about 260 mAh/g, the material falls short of the best results reported elsewhere—around 300 mAh/g—but is still reasonably good."In fact, we considered both winter hogweed, which is safe for harvesting, and the nasty summer hogweed in full bloom. Hate to tell you, but the specimens gathered in the summer proved better in terms of the Coulombic efficiency of the end product, which is the characteristic we emphasized in this study, because it tends to be the weak spot of hard carbon anodes. As for the energy storage capacity, there are ways we can probably improve it later on," Bobyleva added.The team tested three popular approaches to hard carbon synthesis. First, there's direct carbonization: heating the biomass to 1,300 degrees Celsius in an atmosphere without oxygen. Alternatively, you can treat the biomass with an acid to remove metallic and other impurities prior to carbonization. This approach resulted in a significantly higher Coulombic efficiency. Or you can boil the hogweed biomass in water in a closed reactor—this produces very small carbon-containing spheres. While all three approaches led to comparable energy storage capacity, heat treatment with prior impurity removal resulted in the best Coulombic efficiency."The demand for rechargeable accumulators will continue to grow. And when it comes to stationary batteries deployed at induaial facilities and in the production of renewable energy to even out fluctuations in available sunlight or wind power, the sodium-ion technology appears very promising. These batteries will be much cheaper, and while they might be heavier and bulkier, it won't be much of a problem for the relevant applications," study co-author Professor Artem Abakumov said; he heads the Center for Energy Science and Technology at Skoltech.
abaact: 近日，俄罗斯斯科尔科沃科技学院的研究人员实现了将有毒杂草转化为钠离子电池的阳极材料。在研究中，研究人员发现用名为Sosnowsky的杂草生产出来的硬碳能够表现出87%的库仑效率，这与从其他原料合成的硬碳的最佳结果持平。这一特性反映了该材料具有强大的储存能量的能力，其储能能力约260毫安时/克。这种硬碳为钠离子电池的阳极提供了最佳的性能组合，它的结构可以容纳钠离子并在多次循环中释放它们，而且它在充电时不会明显膨胀，这些都有利于电池的运行。这项研究开发了一种全新的锂离子电池阳极的廉价替代品，它适用于一些不要求体积的场合，如太阳能和风力发电场。

title: 美国发布风险管理框架旨在提高人工智能安全可信度
keyword: 人工智能风险管理框架 人工智能系统 人工智能技术
content_zh: NIST风险管理框架旨在提高人工智能的可信度。《指南》寻求培养对人工智能技术的信任，促进人工智能创新，同时减轻风险。华盛顿--美国商务部国家标准和技术研究所(NIST)发布了人工智能风险管理框架（AI RMF 1.0)，这是一份指导文件，供设计、开发、部署或使用人工智能系统的组织自愿使用，以帮助管理人工智能技术的许多风险。 AI RMF遵循国会对NIST制定框架的指示，是与私营和公共部门密切合作制定的。 随着技术的继续发展，它旨在适应人工智能领域，并被组织以不同程度和不同能力使用，以便社会能够从人工智能技术中受益，同时免受其潜在危害。商务部副部长唐·格雷夫斯（Don Graves）表示：“这一自愿框架将有助于开发和部署人工智能技术，使美国、其他国家和组织能够提高人工智能的可信度，同时基于我们的民主价值观管理风险。” “它应该加快人工智能创新和增长，同时推进--而不是限制或损害--所有人的公民权利、公民自由和公平。”与传统软件相比，人工智能带来了许多不同的风险。 人工智能系统是根据数据进行训练的，这些数据可能会随着时间的推移而变化，有时会显著地和意外地变化，以难以理解的方式影响系统。 这些系统在本质上也是“社会技术”的，这意味着它们受到社会动态和人类行为的影响。 人工智能风险可能来自这些技术和社会因素的复杂相互作用，影响人们的生活，从他们使用在线聊天机器人的经历到工作和贷款申请的结果。 该框架使组织能够以不同的方式思考AI和风险。 它促进了机构文化的变革，鼓励组织以新的视角对待人工智能--包括如何思考、交流、衡量和监测人工智能风险及其潜在的积极和消极影响。 AI RMF提供了一个灵活的、结构化的和可测量的过程，使组织能够解决AI风险。 遵循这一管理人工智能风险的过程可以最大限度地发挥人工智能技术的好处，同时减少对个人、团体、社区、组织和社会产生负面影响的可能性。标准和技术部副部长兼NIST主任劳里·E·洛卡西奥（Laurie E.Locascio）表示，该框架是NIST培养对人工智能技术信任的更大努力的一部分--如果这项技术要被社会广泛接受，这是必要的。 Locascio说：“人工智能风险管理框架可以帮助任何行业和任何规模的公司和其他组织启动或加强他们的人工智能风险管理方法。” “它提供了一种新的方式来整合负责任的实践和可操作的指导，以操作可信和负责任的人工智能。 我们期望人工智能RMF有助于推动最佳实践和标准的发展。“人工智能RMF分为两个部分。 第一部分讨论了组织如何构建与人工智能相关的风险，并概述了值得信赖的人工智能系统的特征。 第二部分是框架的核心，描述了治理、地图、度量和管理四个具体功能，以帮助组织解决人工智能系统在实践中的风险。 这些功能可以应用于特定于上下文的用例和AI生命周期的任何阶段。NIST与私营和公共部门密切合作，已经开发AI RMF 18个月了。 该文件反映了NIST从240多个不同组织收到的关于框架草案版本的大约400组正式评论。 NIST今天发布了一些已经承诺使用或推广该框架的组织的声明。该机构今天还发布了一个附带的自愿AI RMF剧本，其中建议了导航和使用该框架的方法。 NIST计划与人工智能社区合作，定期更新该框架，并欢迎随时为Playbook的添加和改进提出建议。 2023年2月底前收到的评论将被纳入2023年春季发布的Playbook更新版本。此外，NIST计划推出一个值得信赖和负责任的AI资源中心，以帮助组织将AI RMF 1.0付诸实践。 工程处鼓励各组织制定和分享如何在其具体情况下使用该系统的简介。 提交的材料可以发送到aiframework@nist.gov.nist致力于继续与公司、民间社会、政府机构、大学和其他方面合作，以制定额外的指导意见。 该机构今天发布了这项工作的路线图。该框架是
content_en: NIST Risk Management Framework Aims to Improve Trustworthiness of Artificial IntelligenceNew guidance seeks to cultivate trust in AI technologies and promote AI innovation while mitigating risk.WASHINGTON — The U.S. Department of Commerce’s National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) has released its Artificial Intelligence Risk Management Framework (AI RMF 1.0), a guidance document for voluntary use by organizations designing, developing, deploying or using AI systems to help manage the many risks of AI technologies. The AI RMF follows a direction from Congress for NIST to develop the framework and was produced in close collaboration with the private and public sectors. It is intended to adapt to the AI landscape as technologies continue to develop, and to be used by organizations in varying degrees and capacities so that society can benefit from AI technologies while also being protected from its potential harms.“This voluntary framework will help develop and deploy AI technologies in ways that enable the United States, other nations and organizations to enhance AI trustworthiness while managing risks based on our democratic values,” said Deputy Commerce Secretary Don Graves. “It should accelerate AI innovation and growth while advancing — rather than reaicting or damaging — civil rights, civil liberties and equity for all.” Compared with traditional software, AI poses a number of different risks. AI systems are trained on data that can change over time, sometimes significantly and unexpectedly, affecting the systems in ways that can be difficult to understand. These systems are also “socio-technical” in nature, meaning they are influenced by societal dynamics and human behavior. AI risks can emerge from the complex interplay of these technical and societal factors, affecting people’s lives in situations ranging from their experiences with online chatbots to the results of job and loan applications. The framework equips organizations to think about AI and risk differently. It promotes a change in institutional culture, encouraging organizations to approach AI with a new perspective — including how to think about, communicate, measure and monitor AI risks and its potential positive and negative impacts. The AI RMF provides a flexible, auctured and measurable process that will enable organizations to address AI risks. Following this process for managing AI risks can maximize the benefits of AI technologies while reducing the likelihood of negative impacts to individuals, groups, communities, organizations and society.The framework is part of NIST’s larger effort to cultivate trust in AI technologies — necessary if the technology is to be accepted widely by society, according to Under Secretary for Standards and Technology and NIST Director Laurie E. Locascio. “The AI Risk Management Framework can help companies and other organizations in any sector and any size to jump-start or enhance their AI risk management approaches,” Locascio said. “It offers a new way to integrate responsible practices and actionable guidance to operationalize trustworthy and responsible AI. We expect the AI RMF to help drive development of best practices and standards.”The AI RMF is divided into two parts. The first part discusses how organizations can frame the risks related to AI and outlines the characteristics of trustworthy AI systems. The second part, the core of the framework, describes four specific functions — govern, map, measure and manage — to help organizations address the risks of AI systems in practice. These functions can be applied in context-specific use cases and at any stages of the AI life cycle.Working closely with the private and public sectors, NIST has been developing the AI RMF for 18 months. The document reflects about 400 sets of formal comments NIST received from more than 240 different organizations on draft versions of the framework. NIST today released statements from some of the organizations that have already committed to use or promote the framework.The agency also today released a companion voluntary AI RMF Playbook, which suggests ways to navigate and use the framework. NIST plans to work with the AI community to update the framework periodically and welcomes suggestions for additions and improvements to the playbook at any time. Comments received by the end of February 2023 will be included in an updated version of the playbook to be released in spring 2023.In addition, NIST plans to launch a Trustworthy and Responsible AI Resource Center to help organizations put the AI RMF 1.0 into practice. The agency encourages organizations to develop and share profiles of how they would put it to use in their specific contexts. Submissions may be sent to AIFramework@nist.gov.NIST is committed to continuing its work with companies, civil society, government agencies, universities and others to develop additional guidance. The agency today issued a roadmap for that work.The framework is part of NIST’s broad and growing portfolio of AI-related work that includes fundamental and applied research along with a focus on measurement and evaluation, technical standards, and contributions to AI policy.
abaact: 近日，美国商务部国家标准与技术研究院(NIST)发布了人工智能风险管理框架(AI RMF 1.0)，这是一份供人工智能系统设计、开发、部署或使用的组织自愿使用的指导性文件，以帮助管理人工智能技术的诸多风险。该框架主要分为两部分，第一部分为讨论如何组织构建与人工智能相关的风险，并概述可信赖的人工智能系统特征。第二部分是框架的核心，描述了治理、映射、测量和管理四个功能，以帮助相关组织在实践中应对人工智能系统风险。研究人员表示，该框架可为组织提供灵活、结构化、可衡量的流程，使其能够应对人工智能风险，有望推动人工智能技术的研发实践和标准化发展，并在遵循管理人工智能风险流程基础上最大限度地发挥人工智能技术优势，同时降低对个人、团体、社区、组织和社会产生负面影响的可能性。

title: 日本开发了一种新型能量采集器
keyword: 能量采集器 可穿戴设备 压电效应
content_zh: 高性能紧凑型振动能量收割机为可穿戴设备自动充电而设计，行走不仅可以提高你自己的能量，还可以潜在地提高你可穿戴电子设备的能量。 大坂都市大学的科学家们发明了一种动态放大镜增强的压电振动能量收集器，这在自动充电可穿戴设备方面取得了重大进展，该设备可以将脉冲振动（如人类行走）产生的功率放大约90倍，同时保持与目前开发的能量收集器一样小。 研究结果发表在《应用物理学》杂志上。如今，人们携带多种电子设备，如智能手机，可穿戴设备预计在不久的将来会越来越普遍。 由此产生的对这些设备更有效再充电的需求增加了对能量收集的关注，能量收集是一种将热和光等能量转化为电力的技术，可以为小型设备供电。 一种被称为振动能量收集的能量收集方式被认为非常实用，因为它可以将振动中的动能转化为电能，并且不受天气或气候的影响。大坂都市大学工学研究生院副教授吉村武（Takeshi Yoshimura）领导的研究小组开发了一种直径仅约2厘米的微机电系统(MEMS)压电振动能量收集器，该系统带有一个被称为动态放大镜的U形金属部件。 与传统的收割机相比，新的收割机可以将由人类行走运动产生的脉冲振动转换成的功率增加约90倍。该团队一直在开发利用压电效应的振动能量收割机，压电效应是一种特殊类型的材料对施加的压力产生电荷或电压的现象。 到目前为止，他们已经成功地从频率恒定的机械振动中产生了微瓦级的电力，例如由马达和洗衣机产生的振动。 然而，当所施加的振动是非平稳和脉冲的时，如人类行走产生的振动时，这些收割机的发电量会急剧下降。针对这一挑战，团队开发并在收割机下集成了U形振动放大组件。 该组件允许在不增加设备尺寸的情况下提高发电能力。 这项技术预计将从包括行走运动在内的非稳定振动中产生电力，以便为智能手机和无线耳机等小型可穿戴设备供电。吉村教授总结道：“由于电子设备有望变得更加节能，我们希望这项发明将有助于实现自充电可穿戴设备。”
content_en: High-performance and compact vibration energy harvester created for self-charging wearable devicesWalking can boost not only your own energy but also, potentially, the energy of your wearable electronic devices. Osaka Metropolitan University scientists made a significant advance toward self-charging wearable devices with their invention of a dynamic magnifier-enhanced piezoelectric vibration energy harvester that can amplify power generated from impulsive vibrations, such as from a human walking, by about 90 times, while remaining as small as currently developed energy harvesters. The results were published in Applied Physics Letters.These days, people carry multiple electronic devices such as smartphones, and wearable devices are expected to become increasingly widespread in the near future. The resulting demand for more efficient recharging of these devices has increased the attention paid to energy harvesting, a technology that converts energy such as heat and light into electricity that can power small devices. One form of energy harvesting called vibration energy harvesting is deemed highly practical given that it can transform the kinetic energy from vibration into electricity and is not affected by weather or climate.A research team led by Associate Professor Takeshi Yoshimura from the Graduate School of Engineering at Osaka Metropolitan University has developed a microelectromechanical system (MEMS) piezoelectric vibration energy harvester that is only approximately 2 cm in diameter with a U-shaped metal component called a dynamic magnifier. Compared with conventional harvesters, the new harvester allows for an increase of about 90 times in the power converted from impulsive vibrations, which can be generated by the human walking motion.The team has been working on developing vibration energy harvesters that utilize the piezoelectric effect, a phenomenon in which specific types of materials produce an electric charge or voltage in response to applied pressure. So far, they have succeeded in generating microwatt-level electricity from mechanical vibrations with a constant frequency, such as those generated by motors and washing machines. However, the power generation of these harvesters drops drastically when the applied vibrations are nonstationary and impulsive, such as those generated by human walking.Responding to this challenge, the team developed and incorporated the U-shaped vibration amplification component under the harvester. The component allowed for improvement in power generation without increasing the device size. The technology is expected to generate electric power from non-steady vibrations, including walking motion, in order to power small wearable devices such as smartphones and wireless earphones.Professor Yoshimura concluded, "Since electronic devices are expected to become more energy-efficient, we hope that this invention will contribute to the realization of self-charging wearable devices."
abaact: 近日，日本大阪城市大学的研究人员为可穿戴设备开发了一种新型能量采集器。该团队利用压电效应来实现设备能量的采集，到目前为止，他们已经成功地通过恒定频率的机械振动产生了微瓦级的电力。并且为了应对非平稳或者是脉冲震动时，能量采集器的发电量急剧下降的情况，还开发了一种被称为动态放大器的U形金属组件，该组件允许在不增加设备尺寸的情况下提高发电效率。他们开发的微机电系统压电振动能量采集器的直径仅约2厘米，与传统能量采集器相比这种新型能量采集器可以将脉冲振动(如人类行走)产生的功率放大约90倍。该技术有望利用非稳态振动来为智能手机和无线耳机等小型可穿戴设备供电。

title: 德国实现了优化多层有机太阳能电池的性能和稳定性
keyword: 低聚物 半导体层 有机太阳能电池 特定分子衍生物
content_zh: 研究人员优化了多层有机太阳能电池的性能和稳定性。由低聚物制成的受体层可以提高有机太阳能电池的性能，同时保证长的工作寿命。 这是由弗里德里希-亚历山大-大学部的材料科学家进行的一系列复杂实验室实验的结果。 有机太阳能电池比传统的硅模块制造起来不那么复杂，而且由于它们可以灵活和透明而具有更多的通用性。 研究人员的发现发表在《自然·能源》杂志上。乌克兰战争继续鲜明地提醒我们，尽快停止对化石燃料的依赖是多么重要。 再生能源的迅速扩展是这方面成功的关键之一。 以光伏发电为例，困难不仅涉及提高产量的斗争，还涉及新应用的开发，因为在人口稠密的工业国家，如德国，太阳能电池板可用的表面积有限。这就是为什么目前对有机光伏发电进行了如此多的研究。 与传统系统中使用的硅不同，有机太阳能电池由碳基半导体组成，它们从溶液中直接应用到支撑膜上。 这意味着这些模块是灵活的，可以是半透明的或完全透明的，这在城市空间开辟了广泛的潜在应用，包括在窗格中的使用。两个世界中最好的选择半导体层的最佳材料对研究人员来说是一个重大挑战：“例如，如果我们使用具有非常长分子链的聚合物，这些模块对温度波动的抵御能力很强，使用寿命更长，”克里斯托夫·布拉贝克教授博士说， FAU材料科学（电子材料和能源技术）主席，埃尔兰根-纽伦堡可再生能源亥姆霍兹研究所所长。 “然而，聚合物的定义不是很好，由于其复杂性，有更多的缺陷，这可能导致在微光水平下输出更低。”为了寻找电子转移的替代品，因此HIERN的研究活动正在加强，对被称为低聚物的分子进行研究。 它们的链比聚合物链更短，设计更精确，在近红外光下具有更高的效率。 缺点是低聚物对温度波动更敏感，而且通常更不稳定。由克里斯托弗·布拉贝克领导的国际工作组旨在通过开发低分子非富勒烯半导体来结合这两个世界的精华，这些半导体既有高产量，又坚固耐用。 他们将目光投向了一种名为Y6的特殊分子的衍生物，该分子具有对称结构，由碳以及氮、氢、氧、硫和溴原子组成。“我们在无数次测试中修饰了该分子，并检查了它作为受体层的性质，”在FAU进行实验的博士生张迪飞解释说。在调查期间，华南理工大学的研究人员也参与了调查， 利用二维广角X射线散射测量分析了分子链的微观结构和行为，最终获胜者是OY3，分子结构的复杂微调最终产生了一个有希望的候选--缩写为OY3的低聚物。 Brabec说：“OY3的平均性能效率为15%，我们也用其他一些衍生工具测量了这个值。” “然而，给我们留下深刻印象的是它出色的光稳定性。”即使在200小时的操作后，低聚物仍保持了最初产量的94%。 进一步的测量显示，运行寿命超过25000小时，平均每年运行1500小时，相当于16年以上的运行寿命。布拉贝克说，“这些参数对于多层有机光伏组件来说是独特的，满足了快速商业化的所有要求。我们的目标低聚物设计策略将有机光伏提高到了一个新的效率水平，并使其非常接近实际应用。”
content_en: Researchers optimize performance and stability of multi-layer organic solar cellsAcceptor layers made of oligomers can increase the performance of organic solar cells and ensure a long operating life at the same time. This is the result of a series of complex laboratory experiments conducted by materials scientists at Friedrich-Alexander-Universit?t Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU). Organic solar cells are less complex to manufacture than conventional silicon modules and are considerably more versatile as they can be flexible and transparent. The researchers' findings have been published in the journal Nature Energy.The war in Ukraine continues to serve as a stark reminder of how important it is for us to cease our dependency on fossil fuels as quickly as possible. The rapid expansion of regenerative energy sources is one of the keys to success in this respect. In the case of photovoltaics, for example, the difficulties not only involve the auggle for higher output, but also the development of new applications as the surface area available for solar panels is limited in densely-populated induaial nations such as Germany.This is the reason why so much research is currently being carried out on organic photovoltaics. In contrast to the silicon used in conventional systems, organic solar cells consist of carbon-based semi-conductors that are directly applied from a solution onto a supporting film. This means the modules are flexible and can be translucent or completely transparent, which opens up a wide range of potential applications in urban spaces, including use in window panes.The best of both worldsSelecting the best material for the semiconductor layers is a significant challenge for researchers: "For example, if we use polymers with very long chains of molecules, the modules are robust against fluctuations in temperature and have a longer operating life," says Prof. Dr. Christoph Brabec, Chair of Materials Science (Materials in Electronics and Energy Technology) at FAU and Director of the Helmholtz Institute Erlangen-Nürnberg for Renewable Energy (HI ERN). "However, polymers are not very well defined and have more defects due to their complexity, which can lead to lower output in low light levels."In the search for alternatives to electron transfer, research activities at HI ERN are therefore being stepped up with research into molecules known as oligomers. Their chains are shorter, they can be designed more precisely and they have a higher efficiency in near-infrared light than polymer chains. The disadvantage is that oligomers are more sensitive to temperature fluctuations and are generally more instable.The international working group led by Christoph Brabec aims to combine the best from both worlds by developing low-molecule non-fullerene semiconductors that have a high output while being robust and durable at the same time. They have set their sights on derivatives of a particular molecule called Y6, which has a symmetrical aucture and is comprised of carbon as well as nitrogen, hydrogen, oxygen, sulfur and bromine atoms."We modified the molecule in countless tests and examined its properties as an acceptor layer," explains Difei Zhang, a doctoral candidate who conducted the experiments at FAU.During the investigations, which also involved researchers from the South China University of Technology (SCUT), two-dimensional wide angle X-ray scattering measurements were used to analyze the microaucture and behavior of the molecule chains.And the winner is OY3The complex fine tuning of the molecular aucture finally produced a promising candidate—an oligomer with the abbreviation OY3. "OY3 has an average performance efficiency of 15%, a value that we have also measured with some other derivatives," says Brabec. "However, what also impressed us was its excellent photostability."The oligomer retained 94% of its original output even after 200 hours of operation. Further measurements showed an operating life of more than 25,000 hours, which, with an average operation of 1,500 hours per year, is equivalent to an operating life of more than 16 years.Brabec says, "These parameters are unique for multi-layer organic photovoltaic modules and fulfill all requirements for rapid commercialization. Our aategy of targeted oligomer design takes organic photovoltaics to a new level of efficiency and brings them very close to practical application."
abaact: 近日，德国纽伦堡分校发现低聚物制成的半导体层可以提高有机太阳能电池的性能，同时还能确保电池拥有较长的使用寿命。该团队采用了一种名为Y6的特定分子衍生物，该分子具有对称结构，由碳、氮、氢、氧、硫和溴原子组成。为了使半导体层具有高产量的同时坚固又耐用，研究团队在无数次的测试中修改了分子，并检查其作为半导体层的特性。研究结果表明，对分子结构进行的复杂的微调会产生一种被称为OY3低聚物的候选者，该候选者的平均性能效率为15%，并且还具有出色的耐光性，这让低聚物即便在运行200个小时后仍然能保持其原始产量的94%。目前，该团队希望下一步通过低聚物设计策略让有机光伏技术得到提升，让其更接近实际应用。

title: 美国研发出基于AlScN材料的铁磁二极管计算架构
keyword: AlScN 铁磁二极管 计算架构 人工智能 片上存储
content_zh: 美国团队开发基于ALSCN的人工智能计算架构宾夕法尼亚大学工程与应用科学学院的研究人员团队与来自桑迪亚国家实验室和布鲁克海文国家实验室的科学家一起，推出了一种基于ALSCN铁二极管的计算架构。据称，基于ALSCN的内存计算(CIM)架构是人工智能的理想选择，它允许处理和存储发生在同一个地方，消除了传输时间，并将能耗降至最低。 这项工作发表在Nano Letters上。AlSCN的优点是它可以在足够低的温度下沉积，与硅铸造厂兼容。 “大多数铁电材料需要更高的温度。 研究人员特洛伊·奥尔森说：“ALSCN的特殊性质意味着我们演示的存储设备可以在垂直异质集成堆栈中位于硅层之上。”2021年，该团队建立了ALSCN作为内存计算发电站的可行性。 它的小型化、低成本、资源效率、易于制造和商业可行性在研究和工业领域显示了巨大的进步。在最近的研究中，团队观察到他们的CIM铁二极管的性能可能比传统计算架构快100倍。该领域的其他研究已经成功地使用内存计算架构来提高人工智能应用的性能。 然而，这些解决方案是有限的，无法克服性能和灵活性之间的矛盾。 使用忆阻器交叉阵列的计算架构也展示了令人钦佩的速度，这种设计模仿了人脑的结构，以支持神经网络操作的高水平性能。然而，神经网络操作使用多层算法来解释数据和识别模式，只是功能性人工智能所需的几类关键数据任务之一。 这种设计的适应性不足以在任何其他人工智能数据操作上提供足够的性能。宾夕法尼亚大学的团队表示，他们的铁二极管设计提供了其他内存计算架构所没有的开创性灵活性。 它实现了卓越的精确度，在构成有效AI应用基础的三个基本数据操作中表现同样出色，而不是一个。 它支持片上存储，或容纳深度学习、并行搜索（一种允许精确数据过滤和分析的功能）和矩阵乘法加速（神经网络计算的核心过程）所需的大量数据的能力。该项目的共同负责人Deep Jariwala表示：“重要的是要认识到，目前所有的AI计算都是在几十年前设计的硅硬件架构上实现的软件支持的。” “这就是为什么人工智能作为一个领域一直由计算机和软件工程师主导。 从根本上说，为人工智能重新设计硬件将是半导体和微电子领域的下一个重大游戏规则改变者。 我们现在的方向是硬件和软件协同设计。“刘锡文等人的《现场可编程铁电二极管上的可重构内存计算》； 纳米字母2022 22（18）
content_en: US Team Develops AlScN-based AI Computing ArchitectureA team of researchers from the University of Pennsylvania's School of Engineering and Applied Science, with scientists from Sandia National Laboratories and Brookhaven National Laboratory, has introduced a computing architecture based on ferro-diodes made of AlScN.Said to be ideal for AI, the AlScN-based compute-in-memory (CIM) architecture allows processing and storage to occur in the same place, eliminating transfer time as well as minimising energy consumption. The work was published Nano Letters.AlScN has the advantage that it can be deposited at temperatures low enough to be compatible with silicon foundries. “Most ferroelectric materials require much higher temperatures. AlScN's special properties mean our demonaated memory devices can go on top of the silicon layer in a vertical hetero-integrated stack," said researcher Troy Olson.In 2021, the team established the viability of the AlScN as a compute-in-memory powerhouse. Its capacity for miniaturisation, low cost, resource efficiency, ease of manufacture and commercial feasibility demonaated serious aides in the eyes of research and induay.In the most recent study , the team observed that their CIM ferrodiode may be able to perform up to 100 times faster than a conventional computing architecture.Other research in the field has successfully used compute-in-memory architectures to improve performance for AI applications. However, these solutions have been limited, unable to overcome the conflicting trade-off between performance and flexibility. Computing architecture using memristor crossbar arrays, a design that mimics the aucture of the human brain to support high-level performance in neural network operations, has also demonaated admirable speeds.Yet neural network operations, which use layers of algorithms to interpret data and recognize patterns, are only one of several key categories of data tasks necessary for functional AI. The design is not adaptable enough to offer adequate performance on any other AI data operations.The Penn team says their ferrodiode design offers groundbreaking flexibility that other compute-in-memory architectures do not. It achieves superior accuracy, performing equally well in not one but three essential data operations that form the foundation of effective AI applications. It supports on-chip storage, or the capacity to hold the enormous amounts of data required for deep learning, parallel search, a function that allows for accurate data filtering and analysis, and matrix multiplication acceleration, the core process of neural network computing.“It is important to realize that all of the AI computing that is currently done is software-enabled on a silicon hardware architecture designed decades ago,” says Deep Jariwala, who co-led the project. “This is why artificial intelligence as a field has been dominated by computer and software engineers. Fundamentally redesigning hardware for AI is going to be the next big game changer in semiconductors and microelectronics. The direction we are going in now is that of hardware and software co-design.”'Reconfigurable Compute-In-Memory on Field-Programmable Ferroelectric Diodes' by Xiwen Liu et al; Nano Letters 2022 22 (18)
abaact: 近日，由美国宾夕法尼亚大学领导的一个研究团队研发出一种基于AlScN材料的铁磁二极管计算架构。基于AlScN材料的内存计算（CIM）架构有望成为人工智能的理想选择，允许同地处理和存储数据的特点可实现节能提速的效果。2021年团队证实了用AlScN材料建立内存计算架构的可行性。最近的研究中，团队发现CIM架构的执行速度可能比传统的计算架构快100倍。这种铁磁二极管设计提供了其他内存计算架构不具备的突破性、灵活性和准确性，并在构成有效人工智能应用程序基础的三种基本数据操作中同样表现出色。此外，该设计还支持片上存储、并行搜索以及矩阵乘法加速等功能，涉及深度学习、神经计算网络等不同细分领域。鉴于当前所有人工智能计算都是通过几十年前设计的硅硬件架构上的软件实现的，于是为人工智能重新设计硬件将成为半导体和微电子领域的下一个重大变革。

title: 英国开发出可以增强网络稳健性的新型光纤
keyword: 光纤 光纤网络 信息传输 拓扑数学原理 改性纤维
